tools: {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB} or one {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB|Arisan's Tool}, and one {@item musical instrument|XPHB}.

entries: {@i Choose A or B:} (A) {@item Studded Leather Armor|XPHB}, {@item Rapier|XPHB}, {@item Whip|XPHB}, {@item Shortbow|XPHB}, A {@item Quiver|XPHB} Containing 20 {@item Arrow|XPHB|Arrows}, {@item Druidic Focus|XPHB} ({@item Totem|PHB}), {@item Entertainer's Pack|XPHB}; and 11 GP; or (B) 160 GP.

tools: One of {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}, one {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB|Artisan's Tool}, or one {@item musical instrument|XPHB}.

entries.name: Spiritualist
entries: A Kitsune Witch is a person who has formed a magical bond with a fox-like creature. Unlike normal foxes, this creature is innately magical. Often the fox has two or more tails when found. Together with this kitsune companion the person develops magic, which will enhance them in combat and other situations.

Kitsune Witches often form this bond with a kitsune they find in trouble. After they help out the kitsune, they will become very loyal to the Witch, often following them home. Even if the Witch is reluctant at first, the kitsune will persist for weeks to thank its saviour, by becoming their best friend.

Kitsune Witches tend to take up the characteristics of their kitsune companion and vice versa. Some will delight in trickery, while others primarily focus on helping their fellow man out. No matter the way they interact with society, a Kitsune Witch will never do it alone.

classFeature.name: Kitsune Companion
entries: A kitsune has chosen you to be its companion. This companionship shows the trust you have in each other and what each of you will do to protect one another, while bonded in such a way.

items.name: Combat
entries: Your kitsune companion obeys your commands as best they can (no action required). They share your initiative count, taking their turn directly after yours. You determine their actions, decisions, attitudes, and so on. If you are incapacitated or absent, your companion acts on their own. If you die, the companion will run away.

items.name: Statistics
entries: Your kitsune companion uses your proficiency bonus instead of their own. In addition to that, your Wisdom modifier is used for various features and abilities, as indicated on one of the {@creature kitsune|WoKiWi} sheet. In addition to that you determine your kitsune companion’s ability scores, using the stats provided below.

items.name: Hit Points
entries: For each level you gain after  1st, your kitsune companion gains an additional hit die and increases {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} accordingly, as shown on the {@creature Kitsune|WoKiWi|sheet}.

items.name: Stat Increase
entries: Whenever you choose an {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} or other Feat, your kitsune companion may increase their ability score as well, in the same fashion as picking the ability score improvement feat. The kitsune companion cannot increase an ability score above 20, using this feature.

items.name: Proficiencies
entries: Your kitsune companion gains proficiency in two skills of your choice and proficiency in Dexterity and Charisma saving throws.

items.name: Dying and Restoration
entries: Whenever your kitsune companion is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and isn’t stable, they will make {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB|Death Saving Throws}. On three failures they won’t die, but will remain unconscious until you spend a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} in quiet contemplation over their body to reawaken it. However, effects that destroy the body will still outright kill it. If this happens, or you don’t have access to the body, you can spend a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} and 25 gold worth of offerings to resummon the spirit of your companion. Your companion will then appear at the end of the {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

items.name: Personality
entries: Your kitsune companion has a personality of their own. You can choose or roll for a personality trait, ideal, and flaw from the tables below. Its bond is always “The witch who is my companion is someone who I would protect at all costs, as long as they would do the same.”

entries.caption: Personality Traits
rows: I’m dauntless in the face of adversity.
If you threaten my friends, you threaten me.
I stay on alert so others can rest.
People see an animal and underestimate me. I use that to my advantage.
I have a knack for showing up in the nick of time.
I put my friends’ needs before my own, in all things.

entries.caption: Ideals
rows: {@b Destiny.} I believe that everyone has a role to play. Now I just have to find mine. (Neutral)
{@b Community.} It's important to surround yourself with people you can count on, and who will support you. (Good)
{@b Knowledge.} I want to learn everything I can about the world. (Neutral)
{@b Freedom.} I don't care what anyone says. Even if it causes problems, everyone should be free. And so should I. (Chaotic)
{@b Structure.} A natural world doesn’t work without balance. Civilisations and relationships are much the same. (Lawful)
{@b Virtuous Cycle.} If I see someone who needs help, I feel compelled to assist them. Surely they'll return the favour someday! (Good)

entries.caption: Flaws
rows: If there’s food left unattended, I’ll eat it.
I growl at strangers, and all people are strangers to me.
Any time is a good time for a belly rub.
I’m jealous of any attention my witch gets, when it is not from me.
My idea of hello is a flurry of licks to the face.
I jump on creatures to tell them how much I love them.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: Your bond with your kitsune companion has granted you the ability to use magic.

items.name: Cantrips (0-Level Spells)
entries: At 1st level, you know two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter kitsune witch spell list|spells|level=0|class=Kitsune Witch (WoKiWi)}. At higher levels, you learn additional kitsune witch cantrips of your choice, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Kitsune Witch table.
When you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of the kitsune witch cantrips you know with another cantrip from the kitsune witch spell list.

items.name: Preparing and Casting Spells
entries: The Kitsune Witch table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your kitsune witch spells. To cast one of your kitsune witch spells of 1st level or higher, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

You prepare the list of kitsune witch spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the kitsune witch spell list. When you do so, choose a number of kitsune witch spells equal to the prepared spells shown in the Kitsune Witch table. The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

For example, if you are a 5th-level kitsune witch, you have four 1st-level and two 2nd-level spell slots, with 6 prepared spells. Your list of prepared spells can include four spells of 1st or 2nd-level, in any combination. If you prepare the 1st-level spell cure wounds, you can cast it using a 1st-level or a 2nd-level slot. Casting the spell doesn't remove it from your list of prepared spells.

You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of Kitsune Witch spells requires time spent playing or spending time with your kitsune companion: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

items.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your kitsune witch spells, since their power derives from the understanding you have with your kitsune companion. You use your Wisdom whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a kitsune witch spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

items.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use a druidic focus as your spellcasting focus. This focus usually symbolises the bond you share with your kitsune companion.

classFeature.name: Weapon Mastery
entries: Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of two kinds of weapons of your choice with which you have proficiency, such as {@item Rapier|XPHB|Rapiers} and {@item Shortbow|XPHB|Shortbows}.

Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can change the kinds of weapons you chose. For example, you could switch to using the mastery properties of {@item Scimitar|XPHB|Scimitars} and {@item Whip|XPHB|Whips}.

classFeature.name: Companionship Style
entries: Your bond is defined by a specific type of companionship. Choose one {@filter Companionship Style|optionalfeatures|feature type=Cost} option. You cannot choose one Companionship Style more than once, even when you later get to choose again at 10th level.

classFeature.name: Fox Senses
entries: Your kitsune companion can share its senses with you for a short while. As a Bonus Action, you can open yourself up to your companion’s senses. For 1 minute you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks. In addition to that, you gain 60 feet of {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} for the same amount of time, provided you didn’t have it already.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you regain all expended uses.
In addition to that, you and your kitsune companion can communicate telepathically, when you are within 60 feet of one another.

classFeature.name: Expertise
entries: Your bond with your kitsune companion grants you expertise in two skills you are already proficient in. In addition to that, you may choose two additional skills your kitsune companion is proficient in.

classFeature.name: Kitsune Witch Subclass
entries: Choose an archetype you and your kitsune companion feel will deepen your bond even further, from {@class Kitsune Witch|WoKiWi|Crippling Kitsune|Crippling|WoKiWi}, {@class Kitsune Witch|WoKiWi|Guarding Kitsune|Guarding|WoKiWi}, {@class Kitsune Witch|WoKiWi|Invigorating Kitsune|Invigorating|WoKiWi}, or {@class Kitsune Witch|WoKiWi|Scarring Kitsune|Scarring|WoKiWi}. Your choice grants features at 3rd level, and again at 7th, 11th, 15th, 20th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@filter feat|feats} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Kitsune Witch levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Companion Feature
entries: Choose a feature for your companion from the {@filter Companion Features|optionalfeatures|feature type=CoFe} list. You can choose another Companion Feature at level 10, 15, and 19. All options may only be picked once, unless indicated otherwise.

classFeature.name: Magical Attacks
entries: You can choose to turn the piercing damage dealt by the attacks from your kitsune companion to instead be force damage.

In addition to that, as a Bonus Action, you can give your kitsune companion a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls for 1 hour. Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again, until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain another Kitsune Subclass feature from your Kitsune Subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@filter feat|feats} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Companion Feature
entries: Choose a feature for your companion from the {@filter Companion Features|optionalfeatures|feature type=CoFe} list. All options may only be picked once, unless indicated otherwise.

classFeature.name: Companionship Style
entries: Your bond is defined by a second specific type of companionship. Choose one {@filter Companionship Style|optionalfeatures|feature type=Cost} option. You cannot choose one Companionship Style more than once.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain another Kitsune Subclass feature from your Kitsune Subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@filter feat|feats} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Tricksy Bond
entries: Your bond with your kitsune companion has made you a master of trickery. Now whenever you cast a spell of the Illusion or Enchantment school of magic, you may increase the Spell Save DC by 2, as a Bonus Action.

classFeature.name: Companion Feature
entries: Choose a feature for your companion from the {@filter Companion Features|optionalfeatures|feature type=CoFe} list. All options may only be picked once, unless indicated otherwise.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain another Kitsune Subclass feature from your Kitsune Subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@filter feat|feats} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Magical Bond
entries: Your bond with your kitsune companion has deepened so much that they have granted you access to one of the most powerful spells it knows. Choose one 6th and one 7th level spell of the {@filter Enchantment or Illusion|spells|school=E;I|level=6;7} school of magic. You may cast each spell once every {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Companion Feature
entries: Choose a feature for your companion from the {@filter Companion Features|optionalfeatures|feature type=CoFe} list. All options may only be picked once, unless indicated otherwise.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@filter Epic Boon feat|feats|category=eb} or another {@filter feat|feats} of your choice for which you qualify. {@feat Boon of Fate|XPHB} is recommended.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain another Kitsune Subclass feature from your Kitsune Subclass.

subclassFeature.name: Crippling Kitsune
entries: {@i Tripping Up your Opponents is a Daily Activity}

A Crippling Kitsune is a kitsune that specialises in debuffing enemies. These are the kitsunes who are often regarded as mysterious, and ones you should be careful around, because once you lose their favour, then you will have to live out your life full of misfortune.

subclassFeature.name: Crippling Spells
entries: When you choose this subclass, you always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Crippling Spells table. These spells count as kitsune witch spells for you, but they don't count against the number of Kitsune Witch spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Kitsune Aspect
entries: Your kitsune companion gains their aspect. This aspect shows which kitsune sheet you’ll be using from now on, as well as certain subclass features you’ll gain. Choose one of these aspects:

items.name: Dark
entries: A kitsune aspected to darkness prefers to operate from the shadows. There they’ll lie in wait and debilitate their enemy, until they are weak enough to kill. If you choose this aspect, you now use the {@creature Dark Kitsune|WoKiWi} statblock for your kitsune companion and gain the following feature:

items.name: Time
entries: Kitsunes aspected to time will use it to their advantage. They’ll set out traps across time, just so the enemy can be killed in one hit whenever the kitsune meets them. If you choose this aspect, you now use the {@creature Time Kitsune|WoKiWi} statblock for your kitsune companion and gain the following feature:

subclassFeature.name: Weakening Weave
entries: You have learned to use your magic to weaken your enemies. You may cast {@spell Weakening Weave|WoKiWi} once without expending a spell slot, but you must finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} before you can cast it in this way again.

subclassFeature.name: Impairing Aura
entries: Your drive to cripple another has manifested around you and your kitsune companion.  You and your kitsune companion gain an aura that has a radius of 5 feet. The effect of the aura depends on your Kitsune’s Aspect. You/they can only grant these benefits while not {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}.
At Kitsune Witch level 15, the radius of the aura increases to 10 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Debilitating Strike
entries: You know the exact areas to strike to temporarily debilitate someone. Once per turn, after you hit a creature with an attack, that creature is affected by one of these three things:

items.name: Attacks Affected
entries: They have disadvantage on all attack rolls.

items.name: No Movement
entries: Their movement is 0 and cannot be increased.

items.name: No Reaction
entries: They cannot take Reactions.
The effect lasts until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Sabotaging Tactics
entries: Your bond with your kitsune companion has granted you a new tactic. This tactic depends on your kitsune’s aspect
When one of you uses this feature, neither can do so again, until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Master Crippler
entries: Your bond with your kitsune companion has reached its maximum potential. This has led you to develop characteristics associated with your kitsune’s aspect. For example, wisps of darkness may flutter around you or time seems to be slightly off around you.
As a Bonus Action you can manifest forth the energy of the master crippler, for 1 minute. You and your kitsune companion gain the following benefits:

items.name: Rolls Affected
entries: Enemies within your aura have disadvantage on all {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests}.

items.name: Weakened Armour
entries: Enemies within your aura have a -2 penalty to their AC.

items.name: Attacks Affected
entries: Enemies within your aura cannot regain {@variantrule Hit Points}.
Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again, until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Guarding Kitsune
entries: {@i Two Protect Better than One}

A Guarding Kitsune is a kitsune that feels very loyal to whomever it considers their friend. It will do everything it can to protect its friends from harm, sometimes even giving their life for the cause.

subclassFeature.name: Guarding Spells
entries: When you choose this subclass, you always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Guarding Spells table. These spells count as kitsune witch spells for you, but they don't count against the number of kitsune witch spells you prepare.

entries.caption: Ancestral Domain Spells
rows: {@spell Protection from Evil and Good|xphb}, {@spell Protecting Weave|wokiwi}, {@spell Sanctuary|xphb}
{@spell Wall of Force|xphb}, {@spell Wall of Stone|xphb}

subclassFeature.name: Kitsune Aspect
entries: Your kitsune companion gains their aspect. This aspect shows which kitsune sheet you’ll be using from now on, as well as certain subclass features you’ll gain. Choose one of these aspects:

items.name: Earth
entries: A kitsune aspected to earth can be moulded as easily as clay, making their skin hard to break. If you choose this aspect, you now use the {@creature Earth Kitsune|WoKiWi} statblock for your kitsune companion and gain the following feature:

items.name: Forest
entries: A kitsune aspected to the forest is a kitsune who has skin as hard as bark, and knows that nature will win eventually. If you choose this aspect, you now use the {@creature Forest Kitsune|WoKiWi} statblock for your kitsune companion and gain the following feature:

items.name: Mountain
entries: A kitsune aspected to the mountain is one that cannot be swayed to move from their place. You may be hurting it, but they’ll never show that you are. If you choose this aspect, you now use the {@creature Mountain Kitsune|WoKiWi} statblock for your kitsune companion and gain the following feature:

subclassFeature.name: Protecting Weave
entries: You have learned to use your magic to give your companions a temporary defensive boost. You may cast {@spell Protecting Weave|XPHB} once without expending a spell slot, but you must finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} before you can cast it in this way again.

subclassFeature.name: Defensive Aura
entries: The will to defend others has manifested around you and your kitsune companion. You and your kitsune companion gain an aura that has a radius of 5 feet. The effect of the aura depends on your kitsune’s aspect. You/they can only grant these benefits while not {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}.
At Kitsune Witch level 15, the radius of the aura increases to 10 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Fortifying Stance
entries: You know the best method to stand your ground. When you end your turn, without having moved, you gain resistance to Acid, Cold, Bludgeoning, Fire, Force, Lightning, Piercing, Poison, Slashing, and Thunder damage, until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Shielding Tactics
entries: Your bond with your kitsune companion has granted you a new tactic. Your new tactic depends on your kitsune's aspect.
When one of you uses this feature, neither can do so again, until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Master Guardian
entries: Your bond with your kitsune companion has reached its maximum potential. This has led you to develop characteristics associated with your kitsune’s aspect. For example, your skin may turn earthy or stony, your hair may become flowery, or you may sprout antlers made out of wood.
As a Bonus Action you can manifest forth the energy of the master guardian, for 1 minute. You and your kitsune companion gain the following benefits:

items.name: Resistance
entries: You and all allies in the aura have resistance to all damage.

items.name: Protection
entries: You and all allies who start their turn within the aura gain 20 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

items.name: Guardian
entries: Enemies within the aura have disadvantage on all attack rolls.
Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again, until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Invigorating Kitsune
entries: {@i Make Others Feel as Lucky as You Two Are}

An invigorating kitsune is one that is full of passion. People believe these kitsunes are associated with love and luck. People will often try to find these kitsunes to bring those things into their life.

subclassFeature.name: Invigorating Spells
entries: When you choose this subclass, you always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Invigorating Spells table. These spells count as kitsune witch spells for you, but they don't count against the number of kitsune witch spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Kitsune Aspect
entries: Your kitsune companion gains their aspect. This aspect shows which kitsune sheet you’ll be using from now on, as well as certain subclass features you’ll gain. Choose one of these aspects:

items.name: Heaven
entries: A kitsune aspected to heaven is the best judge of character and aids any person in need. However, they will only form bonds with those who are pure of heart. If you choose this aspect, you now use the {@creature Heaven Kitsune|WoKiWi} statblock for your kitsune companion and gain the following feature:

items.name: Ocean
entries: A kitsune aspected to the ocean is as vast and complex as the ocean itself. However, if the tides allow it they will prioritise helping those in need. If you choose this aspect, you now use the {@creature Ocean Kitsune|WoKiWi} statblock for your kitsune companion and gain the following feature:

items.name: River
entries: A kitsune aspected to the river sees life as a one way road. To them it is precious to let everyone enjoy their travel, because their end of the road may be soon. If you choose this aspect, you now use the {@creature River Kitsune|WoKiWi} statblock for your kitsune companion and gain the following feature:

items.name: Spirit
entries: A kitsune aspected to the spirit is obsessed with making people do as much good as they can, just so they aren’t tortured after death. If you choose this aspect, you now use the {@creature Spirit Kitsune|WoKiWi} statblock for your kitsune companion and gain the following feature:

subclassFeature.name: Revitalising Weave
entries: You have learned to use your magic to quickly heal your companions. You may cast {@spell Revitalising Weave|XPHB} once without expending a spell slot, but you must finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} before you can cast it in this way again.

subclassFeature.name: Blessing Aura
entries: The will to invigorate others has manifested around you and your kitsune companion. You and your kitsune companion gain an aura that has a radius of 5 feet. The effect of the aura depends on your kitsune’s aspect. You can only grant these benefits while not {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}.
At Kitsune Witch level 15, the radius of the aura increases to 10 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Strengthening Rest
entries: You gain the ability to Strengthen your companions, when you are all catching your breath. As part of a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can give yourself and creatures, up to 4 + your Wisdom modifier, that are resting with you one of three benefits. The benefit must be the same for all that get it.

items.name: Temporary Health
entries: Gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to two times your Kitsune Witch level + your Wisdom modifier.

items.name: Magical Strength
entries: Instead of using their Strength or Dexterity modifier for any {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, they can use your Wisdom modifier.

items.name: Psychic Resistance
entries: Gain resistance to psychic damage.
The benefit lasts until you finish another {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Uplifting Tactics
entries: Your bond with your kitsune companion has granted you a new tactic. Your new tactic depends on your kitsune's aspect.
When one of you uses this feature, neither can do so again, until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Master Invigorator
entries: Your bond with your kitsune companion has reached its maximum potential. This has led you to develop characteristics associated with your kitsune’s aspect. For example, your hair may become like clouds, your skin becomes slightly translucent, or you are always leaving puddles of water where you have stood for a little while.
As a Bonus Action you can manifest forth the energy of the master invigorator, for 1 minute. You and your kitsune companion gain the following benefits:

items.name: Restoration
entries: You and allies, within the aura, regain 10 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the end of their turn.

items.name: Protection
entries: You and allies, within the aura, gain advantage on Attack Rolls.

items.name: Condition Immunity
entries: You cannot be affected by the {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, {@condition Deafened|XPHB}, Diseased, {@condition Frightened|XPHB}, {@condition Paralysed|XPHB}, {@condition Petrified|XPHB}, and {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} conditions. If you are affected by one of those conditions, before activation of this feature, it becomes suppressed while the feature is active.
Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again, until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Scarring Kitsune
entries: {@i Outnumber and Kill Your Foe}

A scarring kitsune is feared by most people. These kitsunes are ones who don’t have patience for mistakes. If you make one, they won’t hesitate to end you quickly. Thus people often avoid these kitsunes as much as possible.

subclassFeature.name: Scarring Spells
entries: When you choose this subclass, you always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Scarring Spells table. These spells count as kitsune witch spells for you, but they don't count against the number of kitsune witch spells you prepare.

entries.caption: Ancestral Domain Spells
rows: {@spell Inflict Wounds|xphb}, {@spell Magic Missile|xphb}, {@spell Painful Weave|wokiwi}

subclassFeature.name: Kitsune Aspect
entries: Your kitsune companion gains their aspect. This aspect shows which kitsune sheet you’ll be using from now on, as well as certain subclass features you’ll gain. Choose one of these aspects:

items.name: Fire
entries: A kitsune aspected to fire has an inferno burning inside of them, one that must be released from time to time. If you choose this aspect, you now use the {@creature Fire Kitsune|WoKiWi} statblock for your kitsune companion and gain the following feature:

items.name: Sound
entries: A kitsune aspected to sound is one that hears everything and can amplify what you hear. Which is often used to deafen their opponent. If you choose this aspect, you now use the {@creature Sound Kitsune|WoKiWi} statblock for your kitsune companion and gain the following feature:

items.name: Thunder
entries: A kitsune aspected to thunder absorbs and releases lighting from its fur at will. They only get their name for the sound this release makes. If you choose this aspect, you now use the {@creature Thunder Kitsune|WoKiWi} statblock for your kitsune companion and gain the following feature:

items.name: Wind
entries: A kitsune aspected to wind is very graceful, just like the wind. They use this grace to quickly slice up their enemies. If you choose this aspect, you now use the {@creature Wind Kitsune|WoKiWi} statblock for your kitsune companion and gain the following feature:

subclassFeature.name: Painful Weave
entries: You have learned how to hurt your foes more efficiently. You may cast {@spell Painful Weave|XPHB} once without expending a spell slot, but you must finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} before you can cast it in this way again.

subclassFeature.name: Damaging Aura
entries: The will to hurt others has manifested around you and your kitsune companion. You and your kitsune companion gain an aura that has a radius of 5 feet. The effect of the aura depends on your kitsune’s aspect. You can only grant these benefits while not {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}.
At Kitsune Witch level 15, the radius of the aura increases to 10 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Wounding Strike
entries: You have learned better ways to increase your chances of inflicting injuries. You are now able to crit on weapon attacks, when you roll a 19 or a 20 on the d20.

subclassFeature.name: Injuring Tactics
entries: Your bond with your kitsune companion has granted you a new tactic. Your new tactic depends on your kitsune's aspect.
When one of you uses this feature, neither can do so again, until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Master Injurerer
entries: Your bond with your kitsune companion has reached its maximum potential. This has led you to develop characteristics associated with your kitsune’s aspect. For example, your hair may resemble fire, your voice is louder than any crowd, lightning sparks across your skin, or your hair is always waving in the wind.
As a Bonus Action you can manifest forth the energy of the master invigorator, for 1 minute. You and your kitsune companion gain the following benefits:

items.name: Damaging Aura
entries: The extra damage from the aura now also adds your Kitsune Witch level to it.

items.name: Extra Attack
entries: You may make an additional attack, as part of the attack action.

items.name: Extra Opportunity Attack
entries: You may make an additional attack as part of the {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} reaction.
Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again, until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

activation.condition: Ending Turn After Not Using Movement.

optionalfeature.name: Archer
entries: While your kitsune companion is within 5ft of an enemy, and not {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}, you gain a +2 to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.

optionalfeature.name: Attacker
entries: While you and your kitsune companion are within 5 feet of each other and the enemy, both of you have advantage on melee weapon attacks, provided neither of you is {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Entertainer
entries: While your target can see you and your kitsune companion within 30 feet of them, and neither is {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}, you may add the Kitsune’s Charisma modifier to your Charisma (Performance and Persuasion) checks.

optionalfeature.name: Interrogator
entries: While your target can see you and your kitsune companion within 30 feet of them, and it neither is {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}, you may add the Kitsune’s Charisma modifier to your Charisma (Intimidation) and Wisdom (Insight) checks.

optionalfeature.name: Protector
entries: When you or an ally is targeted by an attack of an enemy, within 5 feet of your kitsune companion, it can use its Reaction to impose Disadvantage on the attack roll, provided the kitsune companion can see the attacker.

optionalfeature.name: Trickster
entries: While your target can see you and/or your kitsune companion within 30 feet of them, and neither is {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}, you may add the kitsune’s Charisma modifier to your Charisma (Deception) and Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) checks.

optionalfeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: {@i This feature may be chosen up to 2 times}
Your kitsune companion may make an additional attack when taking the attack action.

optionalfeature.name: Grappler
entries: Your kitsune companion has developed the skills necessary to hold their own in close-quarters grappling. They gain the following benefits:

items: They have advantage on attack rolls against a creature they have {@condition Grappled|XPHB}.
They can use their bonus action to make the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} creature be {@condition Restrained|XPHB}, until the Grappled condition ends.

optionalfeature.name: Healer
entries: Your kitsune companion is skilled with healing, allowing them to mend wounds quickly and get you or your allies back in the fight. You gain the following benefits:

items: When they use a {@item Healer's Kit|XPHB} to stabilise a dying creature, that creature also regains 1 {@variantrule Hit PointS|XPHB|Hit Point}.

As an action, they can spend one use of a {@item Healer's Kit|XPHB} to tend to a creature and restore {@variantrule Hit PointS|XPHB} equal to {@dice 2d6} + the companion’s wisdom modifier + your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Keen Mind
entries: Your kitsune companion has the ability to accurately know direction, time, and to figure out mysteries. They gain the following benefits:

items: Your companion gains proficiency in one of Arcana, History, Investigation, Nature, or Religion. If they are already proficient in the chosen skill, they instead gain expertise.
Your companion can take the {@action Study|XPHB} action as a Bonus Action.
Your companion has advantage on Intelligence (Investigation) checks to uncover hidden objects.

optionalfeature.name: Magical Recovery
entries: Your kitsune companion’s body is magical. Due to that they can quickly recover from wounds. They gain the following benefits:

items: When your companion is successfully stabilised they regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to their Constitution modifier (minimum of 1).

Whenever your companion regains {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} as a result of a spell, potion, or class feature (but not this feature), they regain additional {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1).

optionalfeature.name: Magically Inclined
entries: {@i This feature may be chosen multiple times}

Your kitsune has magic of their own. Choose a class: {@filter Artificer|spells|class=artificer|level=0;1}, {@filter Bard|spells|class=bard|level=0;1}, {@filter Cleric|spells|class=cleric|level=0;1}, {@filter Druid|spells|class=druid|level=0;1}, {@filter Kitsune Witch|spells|class=kitsune witch (WoKiWi)|level=0;1}, {@filter Sorcerer|spells|class=sorcerer|level=0;1}, {@filter Warlock|spells|class=warlock|level=0;1}, {@filter Wizard|spells|class=wizard|level=0;1}. You learn two cantrips of your choice from that class's spell list. You gain the following benefits:

items: You learn two cantrips of your choice from that class's spell list.
Choose one 1st-level spell to learn from that same list. Using this feat, you can cast the spell once and you must finish a {@variantrule Short Rest} before you can cast it in this way again.

entries: Choose Charisma or Wisdom to use as the spellcasting ability for these spells. If you pick this feature more than once, you must use the ability you chose previously.

optionalfeature.name: Proficieny Expert
entries: {@i This feature may be chosen multiple times}
Your kitsune companion gains one of two options:

items: (a) They gain proficiency in two skills or tools of your choice and may upgrade one skill they are proficient in to have expertise in.
(b) They gain proficiency in three skills or tools of your choice

optionalfeature.name: Puppy Eyes
entries: Your kitsune companion has learned how to perfect being cute. They get the following benefits:

items: They have advantage on Charisma (deception and persuasion) checks.

As an action they can attempt to force a creature within 15 feet, that can see it, to make a Wisdom saving throw, against 8 + your companion’s charisma modifier + your proficiency bonus. On a failure the creature becomes Charmed until the start of the companion’s next turn. While {@condition Charmed|XPHB} in this way, it must use its action to complete one simple action, of your choice, or make one attack against a target of your choice. If the action is directly harmful to the target, it will instead not use its action. On a success the target is immune to this effect for 8 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Resilient
entries: Your kitsune companion gets proficiency in two ability saving throws of your choice.

optionalfeature.name: Savage Attacker
entries: Once per turn when the kitsune companion rolls damage for an attack, they can reroll a number of damage dice equal to your proficiency bonus. They can use either total for the damage..

optionalfeature.name: Shapeshifter Expert
entries: Your kitsune companion has become an expert in changing shape. They gain the following benefits:

items: Choose up to 3 tiny to large sized beasts, of a Challenge rating of 2 or less. The kitsune companion can now also take those shapes, following the same rules as indicated on the kitsune sheet.

The kitsune companion can shapeshift into a small or medium sized humanoid. In this form they can speak and write the languages you are able to and are proficient in the same weapons you are. The rest of the statistics are the same as the kitsune’s.

optionalfeature.name: Signature Moves
entries: The kitsune has gained new abilities that people normally associate with kitsunes. They gain the following benefits:

items: The kitsune can use its action to turn {@condition Invisible|XPHB}. Anything they are wearing or carrying turns invisible with them, as long as it is on them. The invisibility ends when the kitsune attacks, casts a spell, generally deals damage, or at the start of their next turn.
The kitsune gains a fly (hover) speed of 40 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Skulker
entries: Your kitsune companion has become so adept at stealth. They gain the following benefits:

items: Your companion has advantage on Dexterity (stealth) checks in darkness and heavily obscured areas.
Your companion can take the {@action Hide|XPHB} action as a Bonus Action.
Lightly obscured areas don’t impose disadvantage on Wisdom (perception) checks for your companion.

optionalfeature.name: Shadow Veil
entries: If your kitsune companion deals damage to one creature, you have already damaged this turn, they may use their Bonus Action to attempt to Blind it. The creature must succeed a Constitution saving throw, against your spellcasting save DC, or become {@condition Blinded|XPHB} until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Time Delay
entries: If your kitsune compion deals damage to one creature, you have already damaged this turn, they may use their Bonus Action to slow its responses. It cannot take a Reaction, until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Dark Impairing Aura
entries: An aura of flits of magical darkness surrounds you. Any enemy that starts its turn in it has Disadvantage on their Attack Rolls, until the end of their turn, as flits of darkness momentarily blind them.

optionalfeature.name: Time Impairing Aura
entries: An aura where time is warped surrounds you. Any enemy that starts their turn in the aura can only take an Action or Bonus Action, and have their speed halved, until the end of their turn, as time is slowed around them.

optionalfeature.name: Sabotaging Dark
entries: As an Action you or your kitsune companion can attempt to Blind all creatures of your/their choice, you/they can see within 30 feet. The creature must succeed a Constitution saving throw, against your spellcasting save DC, or be {@condition Blinded|XPHB} for 1 minute.

optionalfeature.name: Sabotaging Time
entries: As an action you or your kitsune companion can attempt to slow time on all creatures of your/their choice, you/they can see within 30 feet. The creature must succeed a Wisdom saving throw or only be able to move up to half their speed, only take an Action or Bonus action, and be unable to take Reactions for 1 minute.

optionalfeature.name: Mouldable Earth
entries: Your kitsune companion can use their Bonus Action to protect an ally that is within 5 feet of them and you. That ally has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, until the start of your next turn or earlier if the ally is more than 5 feet away from you or your kitsune companion.

optionalfeature.name: Blocking Forest
entries: After your kitsune companion hits a creature, you have already hit this turn, they can use their Bonus Action to impose disadvantage on all attack rolls, unless they attack you or your kitsune companion.

optionalfeature.name: Mountain Wall
entries: Your kitsune companion can use their Bonus Action to protect an ally that is within 5 feet of them and you. The AC of the ally increases by a number equal to your wisdom modifier, until the start of your next turn or earlier if the ally is more than 5 feet away from you or your kitsune companion.

optionalfeature.name: Earth Defensive Aura
entries: Earth is as malleable as it can be solid. You and friendly creatures, within the range of the aura, have advantage on ability checks and saveing throws against being {@condition Grappled|XPHB} or {@condition Restrained|XPHB}. In addition to that, they cannot be moved or knocked {@condition Prone|XPHB} against their will.

optionalfeature.name: Forest Defensive Aura
entries: Nature tries to protect everything from the unnatural. You and friendly creatures, within the range of the aura, can add your Wisdom modifier to saving throws made against spells.

optionalfeature.name: Mountain Defensive Aura
entries: A mountain stands strong even after years of harsh conditions. You and allies, within the range of the aura, have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage and damage from effects forcing you to make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Shielding Earth
entries: When you or your kitsune companion see an ally, within 30 feet, fail a saving throw, you/they can use a Reaction to allow them to instantly succeed. They also have resistance to the damage dealt by the effect.

optionalfeature.name: Shielding Forest
entries: When you or your kitsune companion see an enemy, within 15 feet, make a concentration saving throw, you/they can use a Reaction to make thar creature instantly fail the save.

optionalfeature.name: Shielding Mountain
entries: When you or your kitsune companion see an ally, within 30 feet, take damage that would reduce the ally to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you/they can use a Reaction to instead make them drop to an amount of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to two times your Kitsune Witch Level + your Wisdom modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Soothing Heaven
entries: Your kitsune companion can use their Bonus Action, when you and they are within 5 feet of a creature, to give the creature {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Wisdom modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Ocean Waves
entries: Your kitsune companion can use their Bonus Action, after you healed a creature, they can see within 30 feet, this turn, to heal the creature equal to your Wisdom modifier.

optionalfeature.name: River's Flow
entries: Your kitsune companion can use their Bonus Action to give one creature, you and they are within 5 feet of, a bonus to their next weapon attack roll. The bonus is equal to your Wisdom modifier. The bonus to attack rolls, if unused, goes away on the start of your next turn or earlier if the ally is more than 5 feet away from you or your kitsune companion.

optionalfeature.name: Spirit Touch
entries: Your kitsune companion can use their bonus action, when you and they are within 5 feet of a creature, a bonus to their next ability check. This bonus is equal to your Wisdom modifier. The bonus to ability checks, if unused, goes away on the start of your next turn or earlier if the ally is more than 5 feet away from you or your kitsune companion.

optionalfeature.name: Heaven's Blessing Aura
entries: Being in heaven is like being wrapped in a safety blanket. You and allies that end their turn within your aura gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to half your Kitsune Witch level (rounded down) + your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1).

optionalfeature.name: Ocean's Blessing Aura
entries: An ocean is vast, which makes effects fade away much more quickly. You and allies within the aura, have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, {@condition Deafened|XPHB}, and {@condition Frightened|XPHB}. Additionally, you gain resistance to Acid and Fire damage.

optionalfeature.name: River's Blessing Aura
entries: A river will wash away all your ailments. You and allies, within the aura, are immune to the Diseased and {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} conditions and gain resistance to Poison damage. In addition to that Diseases and Poisons already afflicting them, are suppressed while in the aura.

optionalfeature.name: Spirit's Blessing Aura
entries: A spirit cannot sleep or be restrained. You and allies, within the aura cannot be magically put to sleep or be affected by difficult terrain. Additionally, they have advantage on saving throws and checks against being {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB}, knocked {@condition Prone|XPHB}, {@condition Restrained}, and {@condition Stunned|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Uplifting Heaven
entries: You or your kitsune companion can use your/their action to heal one creature, you/they can see within 30 feet, restoring {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to 5 times your Kitsune Witch level.

optionalfeature.name: Uplifting Ocean
entries: You or your kitsune companion can use your/their action to give a number of creatures, up to your Wisdom modifer, you/they can see within 30 feet, immunity to being inflicted by the {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, {@condition Deafened|XPHB}, and {@condition Frightened|XPHB} conditions, for 1 hour.

optionalfeature.name: Uplifting River
entries: You and your kitsune companion can use your/their action to end a Disease, Poison, or Spell Effect of level 7 or lower, on a creature you/they can see within 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Uplifting Spirit
entries: You or your kitsune companion can use your/their action to grant a number of creatures, up to your Wisdom modifier, you/they can see within 30 feet, the ability to move through the spaces of creatures and objects for 1 hour. If the creature ends their turn inside a creature or object, they will take {@dice 1d10} Force damage. During this time, they can choose to make their weapon attacks can deal force damage instead of the normal damage type.

optionalfeature.name: Fire Burst
entries: If your kitsune companion deals damage to one creature, you have already damaged this turn, they can use their Bonus Action to deal additional Fire damage to it. The extra Fire damage is equal to a number of d4s equal to your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Sound Burst
entries: If your kitsune companion deals damage to one creature, you have already damaged this turn, they can use their Bonus Action to deal additional Thunder damage to it. The extra Thunder damage is equal to a number of d4s equal to your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Lightning Burst
entries: If your kitsune companion deals damage to one creature, you have already damaged this turn, they can use their Bonus Action to deal additional Lightning damage to it. The extra Lightning damage is equal to a number of d4s equal to your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Wind Speed
entries: After the kitsune companion attacks one creature, you have already attacked this turn, they can then use their Bonus Action to make another bite attack against them. Hit or miss, the creature takes slashing damage equal to your Wisdom modifier + your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Damaging Fire Aura
entries: Fire consumes anything it touches. You and allies that start their turn within the aura, deal extra fire damage equal to your Wisdom modifier, when they hit with a weapon attack.

optionalfeature.name: Damaging Sound Aura
entries: Sound can shatter everything around it, if it is loud enough. You and allies that start their turn within the aura, deal extra thunder damage equal to your Wisdom modifier, when they hit with a weapon attack.

optionalfeature.name: Damaging Thunder Aura
entries: Thunder follows lightning, which is exactly what enemies will feel. You and allies that start their turn within the aura, deal extra lighting damage equal to your Wisdom modifier, when they hit with a weapon attack.

optionalfeature.name: Damaging Wind Aura
entries: Wind can be quick enough to leave cuts. You and allies that start their turn within the aura, deal extra slashing damage equal to your Wisdom modifier, when they hit with a weapon attack.

optionalfeature.name: Injuring Fire
entries: As an action you can make all your weapon and kitsune companion natural attacks ignite a foe. For 1 minute, when you or your companion hits a creature with a weapon/natural attack, it is ignited. While ignited the creature takes {@damage 1d10} Fire damage at the start of each of their turns. Each hit will increase the over time damage by {@dice 1d10}, to a maximum a number of d10s equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of {@dice 2d10}). It or another creature can use their action to extinguish the fire.

optionalfeature.name: Injuring Sound
entries: When you are or your kitsune companion is hit by an attack you/they can use their reaction to amplify your/their sounds of the attack, back to the attacker. The attacker must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC, or take {@damage 7d10} Thunder damage and be {@condition Deafened|XPHB} until the end of its next turn. On a success it only takes half damage.

optionalfeature.name: Injuring Thunder
entries: You or your kitsune companion can empower one of your/their hits, After you/they hit with an attack, force the target to make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failure it takes {@damage 7d10} Lightning damage and be {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} until the end of its next turn. On a success it only takes half damage.

optionalfeature.name: Injuring Wind
entries: You or your kitsune companion can use your/their action to increase both your speed by 10 feet. Additionally, you/they have advantage on all attack rolls. This effect lasts for 1 minute.

activation.condition: Kitsune Witch and Companion within 5 feet of same Creature.
Creature was Healed by Kitsune Witch this Turn.
Creature took damage from Kitsune Witch and companion this turn.
Creature took damage from Kitsune Witch and Companion this turn.
Creature took damage from Kitsune Witch and Companion this turn.
Creature was attacked by both the Kitsune Witch and the Companion this turn.

spell.name: Fox Fury
entries: You and all creatures of your choice, within range feel a sudden increased will to fight for each other. Each affected creature will have advantage on attack rolls if an ally is within 5-feet of their target, provided they are not {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}.

spell.name: Fox-Fire Flame
entries: As an action a bright flash of fox-fire erupts all around you. Each creature within 20-foot emanation, originating from you, must succeed a Constitution saving throw. A target takes {@damage 5d8} Radiant damage and is {@condition Blinded|XPHB} until the start of your next turn. On a success the target takes half as much damage and is not {@condition Blinded|XPHB}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The extra damage increases by {@scaledamage 5d8|2-9|1d8} for each level after 3rd.

spell.name: Fox-Fire Lash
entries: You conjure forth the luminous light of the fox-fire to lash down your foe. Make a melee spell attack roll against a target within 15-feet of you. On a hit it takes {@damage 1d6} Radiant damage and is {@condition Blinded|XPHB} until the start of their next turn.
In addition to that, any creature underneath the cloud has disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@damage 1d6} when you reach levels 5 ({@damage 2d6}), 11 ({@damage 3d6}), and 17 ({@damage 4d6)}

spell.name: Fox-Fire Sheen
entries: You conjure forth the luminous light of the fox-fire covering a weapon you touch. Until the spell ends, attacks made with that weapon deal an extra {@damage 1d4} Radiant damage on a hit.

spell.name: Foxy Money
entries: You convert an object into coins of the same value. Choose one non-magical object, that is at most medium in size (5-foot cube), to turn into as many coins as it is worth. You can choose which coin type it will turn into.

After 1 hour has passed the money will transform back into the original object. If all coins are within 5-feet of each other, then it returns undamaged. If the coins are further than 5-feet apart, then each coin will try to transform back into the object, as complete as possible. For example, if you had transformed a trapdoor and kept the coins apart in two equal amounts, you get two halves of a trapdoor.

spell.name: Nine Tails
entries: As an action you touch one creature, on which nine fox tails appear, glowing full of magical energy. When you are concentrating on this spell, the target can use a bonus action to use up the magic from one of the nine tails. When they do so, that tail vanishes and grants one of the following effects, of its choice:

items.name: Flash
entries: Fox-fire erupts in a 20-foot radius around the target. Any creature in that area must succeed a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 7d6} Radiant damage. Half as much on a successful save.

items.name: Fly
entries: The target gains a flying speed of 60 feet, until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Invisibility
entries: The target becomes invisible until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Recover
entries: The target heals itself for {@dice 5d6} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

items.name: Zoom
entries: You make the object that the creature will end up holding appear as if it is the original object it was holding. When the creature tries to use it or stops holding it, the illusion fades.

spell.name: Painful Weave
entries: Immediately after you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you may use your bonus action to deal extra damage to it. This extra damage is equal to {@damage 2d8}. The damage type is force or psychic (your choice).

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The extra damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d8|2-9|1d8} for each level after 1st.

spell.name: Possession
entries: You can possess anything at a whim. When you cast this spell, you move 5 feet, directly into the area of a non-incorporeal creature or an object, provided it is not two sizes larger or smaller than you, to possess it. A creature must succeed a Charisma saving throw or become possessed.

A creature possessed by you becomes {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} but is aware of its surroundings. While possessing a creature, you cannot be targeted by an attack, spell, or other effect. You retain all your own statistics, apart from Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, and Speed, which uses the creature’s. You now control the creature you possess and take actions as them.
While possessing an object, you may move  it 30 feet a turn, provided the object isn’t secured to another surface.

The spell ends after a minute, if the creature or object drops to 0 HP, if you use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to end it, or if the creature, upon taking damage, succeeds a Charisma saving throw.
Once the possession ends, you appear in the closest unoccupied space.

spell.name: Protecting Weave
entries: You use your bonus action to temporarily increase the AC and Dexterity saving throw bonus of a creature you can see within 30 feet, by 3. This effect lasts until the start of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The bonus increases by 2 for each spell slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Revitalising Weave
entries: As a bonus action you can heal a creature of your choice, you can see within 30 feet. The creature regains {@dice 2d6} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The extra damage increases by {@scaledice 2d6|2-9|2d6} for each level after 1st.

spell.name: Tricksy Switch

m.text: Any non-magical object you are holding

entries: You can instantly switch an object for someone else’s. Choose a target you can see within range, that is holding a non-magical object. Using an action, its object and yours switch. Upon switching choose one of the following effects:

items.name: Normal Switch
entries: Both items switch normally.

items.name: Damaging Switch
entries: You damage the object that the creature will end up holding. For example glass will shatter, wood will crack, and metal will be bent.

items.name: Illusory Switch
entries: You make the object that the creature will end up holding appear as if it is the original object it was holding. When the creature tries to use it or stops holding it, the illusion fades.

spell.name: Troubling Sleep

m.text: A piece of wool or a pinch of fine sand

entries: With a sweet, but chilling voice and some soft gestures you make creatures’ sleep troubled. Choose a creature you can see within range, it must succeed a Wisdom saving throw or fall unconscious into a nightmare filled sleep. While in this nightmare, it takes {@damage 1d8} Psychic damage at the start of each of their turns.

The nightmare ends when the spell ends, or when the sleeper takes damage, other than this spell’s damage, or someone uses an action to wake the sleeper. If the sleeper wakes up before the spell has ended, they are considered {@condition Frightened|XPHB} for the remaining duration.
Undead creatures, constructs, and creatures immune to being {@condition Charmed|XPHB} aren’t affected by this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You may target another creature for each spell slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Weakening Weave
entries: As a bonus action you give a creature, you can see within 30 feet, disadvantage on {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests}, until the start of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The duration of the spell increases by 1 round for each spell slot level above 1st.

monster.name: Kitsune

hp.special: 8 + {@i [Its Constitution modifier]}; For each level you gain after 1st: 5 (1d8) + {@i [Its Constitution modifier]}; It has a number of Hit Dice {@i [d8]}, equal to your level.

str.special: Assigned based on Kitsune Start Array

dex.special: Assigned based on Kitsune Start Array

con.special: Assigned based on Kitsune Start Array

int.special: Assigned based on Kitsune Start Array

wis.special: Assigned based on Kitsune Start Array

cha.special: Assigned based on Kitsune Start Array

languages: Understands the languages of the Kitsune Witch, but cannot speak.

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: The kitsune has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The Kitsune can use its action to transform into a {@creature Cat|XMM}, {@creature Weasel|XMM}, or back into its original form. It retains its own skill and saving throw proficiencies, Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma ability scores, health, known spells, known companion features, and multiattack in all forms. It uses the other statistics from the form it is currently in. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@i [Its Strength or Dexterity modifier + your Proficieny Bonus]} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 1d6} + {@i [Its Strength or Dexterity modifier]} Piercing damage.

items.name: Shapechanger
entries: The Kitsune can use its action to transform into a {@creature Bat|XMM}, {@creature Cat|XMM}, {@creature Rat|XMM}, {@creature Weasel|XMM}, or back into its original form. It retains its own skill and saving throw proficiencies, Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma ability scores, health, known spells, known companion features, and multiattack in all forms. It uses the other statistics from the form it is currently in. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

items.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@i [Its Strength or Dexterity modifier + your Proficieny Bonus]} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 1d8} + {@i [Its Strength or Dexterity modifier]} Piercing damage.

items.name: Howl of Darkness
entries: A 10-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} of magical darkness appears in an area centred on the kitsune. The darkness remains there for 1 minute, or until it is removed by an effect such as {@spell Dispel Magic|XPHB}, counting as a 1st level spell.
The Kitsune can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). It regains all expended uses when it finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

items.name: Shapechanger
entries: The Kitsune can use its action to transform into a {@creature Badger|XMM}, {@creature Cat|XMM}, {@creature Scorpion|XMM}, {@creature Weasel|XMM}, or back into its original form. It retains its own skill and saving throw proficiencies, Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma ability scores, health, known spells, known companion features, and multiattack in all forms. It uses the other statistics from the form it is currently in. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

items.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@i [Its Strength or Dexterity modifier + your Proficieny Bonus]} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 1d8} + {@i [Its Strength or Dexterity modifier]} Piercing damage.

items.name: Disrupt Earth
entries: The ground in a 15-foot-radius circle, originating from the kitsune, becomes {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. Strong wind or a water current will disperse the earth, removing the {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}.
The Kitsune can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). It regains all expended uses when it finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

items.name: Shapechanger
entries: The Kitsune can use its action to transform into a {@creature Cat|XMM}, {@creature Giant Fire Beetle|XMM}, lit {@item Hooded Lantern|XPHB}, {@creature Weasel|XMM}, or back into its original form. It retains its own skill and saving throw proficiencies, Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma ability scores, health, known spells, known companion features, and multiattack in all forms. entries: Fire erupts from the kitsune. {@actSave dex} DC 8 + {@i [Its Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier (your choice) + your Proficiency Bonus]}, each creature in a 10-foot-radius {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}, originating from the kitsune. {@actSaveFail} Fire damage equal to an amount of {@dice d8s} equal to your proficiency bonus. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

items.name: Nature's Protection
entries: A force of nature creates a physical barrier within 15 feet of the kitsune. The barrier is 15 feet long and 10 feet high. Each 5-foot section has AC of 10 and has 10 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.
The Kitsune can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). It regains all expended uses when it finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

items.name: Heavenly Heal
entries: The kitsune can touch a creature within 5 feet of it, to heal them. This creature will regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to a number of {@dice d8}s equal to your proficiency bonus.
The Kitsune can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). It regains all expended uses when it finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

items.name: Standfast
entries: The kitsune cannot be moved, knocked {@condition Prone|XPHB}, {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, or {@condition Restrained|XPHB} against its will, for 10 minutes or until it becomes {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}.
The Kitsune can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). It regains all expended uses when it finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

reaction.name: Wash Away
entries: When the kitsune, or an ally within 10 feet of them, fails a saving throw, the kitsune can use a Reaction to have them roll again, adding {@i [Its Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier (your choice)]} to the result.
The Kitsune can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). It regains all expended uses when it finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

items.name: Spirit Walk
entries: The kitsune can move through objects and creatures for 1 minute. They take [@damage 1d10] Force damage if they end their turn inside an object or a creature. If the effect ends, while inside an object or creature, they take 1d10 force damage and are moved to the closest unoccupied space.
The Kitsune can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). It regains all expended uses when it finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

items.name: Time Shift
entries: A 10-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} where time is warped appears centred on the kitsune. Any creature, other than the kitsune, in that area has a -2 penalty to AC and can only move half their speed. The time warped area remains there for 1 minute, or until it is removed by an effect such as dispel magic, counting as a 1st level spell.
The Kitsune can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). It regains all expended uses when it finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

items.name: As the Wind Blows
entries: The kitsune gains advantage on all attack rolls for 1 minute or until it becomes incapacitated.
The Kitsune can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). It regains all expended uses when it finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
